question: More people is moving to the big city to live and work. What are the reasons and results of this trend?
text: In this day and age, the majority of people prefer to live in large cities because they believe that the city has opportunities to have a better life. In this essay, multiple reasoning to follow with the consequences of the outcome.

The first reason is that cities have the convenience of transportation. When living in the city, it is not hard going from place to place as vehicles are easy to find. Cities also have various places like hospitals, churches, markets, schools and etc. With available access to transport, it will be hassle-free to reach those destinations. Second, having social life and entertainment. Due to being crowded with people, a person can easily talk to someone and form friendships. The city has also various kinds of entertainment like going to bars and pubs, concerts, gym sports and many more. Lastly, having job opportunities, several businesses and investors are more focused on investing in cities than in urban areas. Furthermore, they build more establishments that will provide work to those who want to start a life in the metropolitan area.

On the other hand, because a great number of people moved to cities, they became overpopulated. As a result, overpopulation may cause a shortage of water and food because the number of people that live in an area has exceeded. In addition, it can cause traffic congestion, for many will buy cars for travelling instead of commuting that would take too much time. Being overpopulated will cause water and air pollution, for many people will just throw their garbage everywhere because no space is provided for them.
